item.title: Senior Expert on Gender Equality in Public Administration (TL)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Study on Gender Equality in Public Administration in the Western Balkans

Global objective

The overall objective of this assignment is to contribute to strengthening girl’s and women’s voice and participation in the Western Balkans, in particular, women’s empowerment and expanded participation in policy-making and leadership in the executive branch of the state.

Specific objectives

The study will cover the Western Balkans (Albania, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Kosovo*, the former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Montenegro and Serbia) and should achieve the following specific objectives:

  • Provide an overview of the current state-of-play, gaps, barriers and challenges to women’s participation in decision-making, both participation in public policy/strategy development and participation in leadership positions. The analysis will focus on the thematic area ‘strengthening voice and participation’ identified in the Gender Action Plan.
  • Analyse country-specific legal frameworks, policies and initiatives indicating major constraints and enabling factors of promoting gender equality and women’s empowerment in public administration.
  • Identify policy and programming recommendations for further action, including specific entry points for the EC to advance women’s equal participation in public administration in the Western Balkans.

Expert 1: Team leader, Senior Expert on Gender Equality in Public Administration (maximum 70 working days)

The team leader (Senior expert – Category I) shall:

  • Plan, supervise, coordinate and monitor the overall implementation of the study;
  • Plan and supervise all the tasks according to the proposed methodology, including research and data collection, performing gender equality analysis and drafting of the study;
  • Supervise the work of the junior experts (experts 2 and 3) to perform all the activities concerning research and collection of relevant data;
  • Ensure backstopping and financial management of the project;
  • Maintain regular communication with the contracting authority.

Competencies:

  • Strong command of data collection and analysis;
  • Strong communication, organization, and time management skills;
  • Ability to perform tasks in timely manner and under pressure, to tight deadlines;
  • Strong interpersonal skills, ability to coordinate and synchronize work with diverse cultural backgrounds, and ability to work in different environments;
  • Ability to communicate in English verbally and in writing with a wide range of stakeholders (e.g. government officials, civil society organizations, etc.) and ability to work collaboratively online and via email;
  • Able to work independently and as part of a team seamlessly using a range of modern means of communication;
  • Excellent report writing skills.

Qualifications and skills:

Education:

  • Masters' Degree in relevant area such as Public Administration, Public Policy, Social and Political Sciences, Gender Studies, International Law, or equivalent.

General experience:

  • Minimum 10 years of relevant professional experience in gender and/or one or more of the areas of governance (with particular emphasis on public administration reforms);
  • Experience in data collection;
  • Experience in project management;
  • Experience coordinating/supervising studies/research projects;
  • Experience in quantitative research and statistical analysis

Specific professional experience:

  • Experience in analysis and research on public administration reform and/or gender mainstreaming in the public sector;
  • Extensive knowledge of the international framework on gender equality and women’s empowerment, particularly in the area of women’s participation in policy and decision-making and leadership;
  • Excellent knowledge of decision-making processes in public policy, public service delivery, institutional capacity building, human resource management policies, professional ethics and/or civil service reform would be desirable;
  • Knowledge of the EU Gender Equality Policy and Gender Action Plan would be considered an asset.
  • Previous experience in the Western Balkans in issues related to public administration reform and/or gender equality will be a strong asset.

Language skills:

  • Excellent spoken and written English
  • Knowledge of any of the languages spoken in the Western Balkans would be a distinctive advantage.

  • Demonstrable experience of economic analysis, formulation of economic development policies in developing countries in particular in the areas related to regional economic integration and multilateral trading system is essential.
  • Good knowledge of WTO and ASEAN Economic Community and status of the implementation of key ASEAN agreements on trade, services and investment is essential.
  • Demonstrable experience of supporting Least Developed Countries (LDCs) to improve market access for international trade will be highly relevant.
  • Demonstrable experience of sustainable development activities that link trade and private sector activities to environment and gender equality will be an asset.
  • Demonstrable experience of industrial analysis, sector policy and value chain development for domestic consumption and export-oriented products from LDCs will be an asset.
  • Familiarity with Myanmar status of economic and social development as well as knowledge of its trade reform, private sector and SME development context will be an asset.

Se evaluarán globalmente y de manera independiente los resultados obtenidos por el PRAIAA (Programa Regional de Apoyo a la Integración Económica Centroamericana y a la Implementación del Acuerdo de Asociación) hasta la fecha, dedicando especial atención al impacto alcanzado a través de las acciones ya implementadas.

De manera particular, se deberá analizar el impacto de las acciones relativas a:

  • el cumplimiento de los compromisos establecidos para Centroamérica en el Acuerdo de Asociación,
  • estrategias y avances en materia de integración económica y facilitación del comercio en la región Centroamericana,
  • el apoyo al sector privado,
  • la sostenibilidad de las acciones del proyecto y su estrategia de salida.

item.title: Expert de de Déminage et de Dépollution de Sols
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Évaluation à mi-parcours du PADEMIN

Les prestations s'inscrivent dans le cadre global du PADEMIN et ont donc pour objectif général “de réduire la pauvreté et promouvoir le développement économique et social durable de la société tchadienne.”

L'évaluation a pour objectifs particuliers de présenter au Maître d'œuvre, à la Délégation de l'Union européenne et plus généralement à l'ensemble des parties concernées par le PADEMIN :

  • une appréciation globale, en toute indépendance, des résultats à mi-parcours du PADEMIN, en s’attachant plus particulièrement aux résultats du projet par rapport à ses objectifs ;
  • les principaux enseignements de l'intervention et des recommandations afin d’améliorer les futures actions, particulièrement celles qui seront mises en œuvre dans le cadre du 11ème FED ou du Fonds fiduciaire d'urgence pour l'Afrique (fenêtre Sahel - Tchad).

Expert de de Déminage et de Dépollution de Sols

Formation Condition minimum

  • Un niveau d’enseignement correspondant à un cycle complet d’études post baccalauréat de quatre années ou plus, sanctionné par un diplôme de fin d’études, dans les domaines de l'économie, du droit, des sciences politiques, sciences humaines ou sociales ou tout autre diplôme de niveau équivalent ;

Une expérience professionnelle générale pertinente de cinq (5) années supplémentaires pourra être prise en compte en cas de diplôme de niveau inférieur.

Expérience Condition minimum

  • 12 ans d’expérience pertinente dans les secteurs concernés par le lot 7.

Conditions préférables

  • 5 ans d’expérience en matière de déminage et de dépollution de sols ;
  • Expérience dans l'identification, la mise en œuvre, le suivi ou l'évaluation de projets de déminage, notamment en Afrique subsaharienne ;
  • Expérience dans l'identification, la mise en œuvre, le suivi ou l'évaluation de projets de réhabilitation physique des personnes handicapées et des victimes des mines et REG ;
  • La connaissance des principes et des méthodes de la Commission européenne acquises lors d’expériences antérieures ;
  • La connaissance du contexte tchadien serait un atout.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Lina_Forgeaux@dai.com
